Statement: Massive potholes on highways are causing frequent accidents.
Broken traffic signals are leading to chaos at major intersections.
Irregular water supply in residential areas for the past month.
Sewage overflow in urban neighborhoods is causing health hazards.
Shortage of doctors and nurses in public hospitals.
Essential medicines unavailable in government pharmacies.
Schools lack basic infrastructure like libraries and laboratories.
Delay in disbursement of scholarships for underprivileged students.
Increase in thefts and burglaries due to lack of police patrolling.
Delayed response from police in case of emergency calls.
Frequent delays and cancellations of public buses without notice.
Poor maintenance of railway stations and lack of hygiene.
Bribes demanded for processing government documents.
Lengthy delays in property registration due to bureaucratic inefficiency.
Illegal dumping of industrial waste in residential areas.
Lack of proper waste collection services leading to garbage accumulation.
Frequent and unannounced power cuts affecting daily life.
Overcharging and incorrect billing in electricity bills.
Unaffordable housing prices pushing middle-class families out of cities.
Illegal encroachments reducing public park spaces.
Sudden price hikes in essential food items without regulation.
False advertising and misleading claims by companies going unchecked.
Lack of employment opportunities despite government job schemes.
Unfair wages and unsafe working conditions for laborers.
Lack of government support for elderly and disabled citizens.
Inadequate rehabilitation programs for homeless individuals.
Misuse of public funds and lack of accountability in government projects.
Nepotism in government job recruitment processes.
Slow emergency response times during natural disasters.
Lack of proper evacuation plans for flood-prone areas.
Complaint 1: Road Maintenance & Traffic Management issue needs urgent resolution in several districts.
